Hoffmann – La Roche, Basel, Switzerland – Departm. of Immunology, Inflammation and Infectious Diseases  Research of drug candidates on their effect on the T cell response using flow cytometry and luminex methods 03/2017 - 04/2017 Research intern at Academia Sinica, Taiwan – Institute of Biomedical Sciences – Lab of Nanomedicine/Nanovaccine   Investigation of formulations in the nanoparticle making process  02/2014 - 05/2016 Sales and Account Management - Industrial Line Scan cameras At Chromasens GmbH, Konstanz, Germany Technical Sales, Customer Support, Training organization at the headquarter in Konstanz, Organization of overseas exhibition/international trading fairs (China), Distributor and customer communication, feedback and discussion with R&D team for product improvements, Customer sample feasibility analysis for (3D-) line scan camera technology, Project management, Customer visits, On-site training  Education   10/2016 - 02/2019  University of Konstanz, Germany / Biological Sciences    Priority track: “Disease Biology” Degree: Master of Science (1.5) 10/2010 - 01/2014 University of Konstanz, Germany / Biological Sciences Degree: Bachelor of Science (2.1) 01/2013 - 05/2013 National University of Singapore, Singapore / Life Sciences International exchange student 
    CV	
Scholarships and awards   03/2017 - 04/2017 Scholarship of the DAAD PROMOS program Mobility grant for self-organised internship abroad at Academia Sinica, Taiwan 01/2013 - 05/2013 Scholarship of the Baden-Württemberg Foundation  Grant for international exchange at the National University of Singapore, Singapore  Laboratory skills  • Primary human cell culture • PBMC isolation, cultivation and differentiation • Antibody-based T cell isolation • Multi-color flow cytometry using BD instruments • Cytokine analysis using multiplexing methods (Luminex) • In vitro immune cell assays, such as cytokine release-, T-cell activation assays • Assay establishment with 96 well microtiter plates • Compound screening and assay establishment • Analytical methods learned during university practical courses: Chromatography, SDS electrophoresis, Western-Blot, Bradford-Assay, FPLC, Primer design and testing, Cloning, RT-qPCR, cell lysis and preparation of cell extracts, isolation of (plasmid-)DNA from bacteria, DNA quantification, proteine purification, yiest: seeding, mating, transduction, transformation, etc.  IT skills  • GraphPad Prism, FlowJo • Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)  Language skills  • Chinese:   Native speaker • German:  Native speaker • English:   Fluent (TOEFL iBT: 98 out of 120) • French:  Basics (4 years French in school)  Extra-curricular activities  10/2011 - 12/2012 Assistance of international students in the biology department  10/2016 - 02/2017 at the University of Konstanz  09/2011 - 03/2012 Tandem partner with LEI (Local Erasmus Initiative)-Konstanz 08/2013 - 01/2014 for support of incoming exchange students from China/Taiwan  08/2007 - 05/2010 Member of the working group “Network Administration” which    maintains the computer system of the school
